result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather M. Padilla was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).
  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.  
Do no reside with any person of the opposite sex without Court's permission if her children are residing with her.   May not have contact with or reside with Kreg D if her son Ethan is residing with her per Court.  DOC shall promptly notify the Court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Heather M. Padilla

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Angela Komp.  Case is resolved.  Amended misd. information filed.  Deft pleads guilty to both counts; found guilty on both counts.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for two years each count concurrent.  See conditions.  Appeal rights.  DNA ordered.
Email received from attys requesting an adjournment of the FPT/JS dates.  Per Court, "ok"
Jury selection on May 4, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial on April 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.
